name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoate has a melting point influenced by its structural components. The basic unit, benzene, has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5 °C. The phenyl group, when considering its effect, should significantly increase the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
